meanings.definition: Not forming part of a system or organization.
meanings.sent1: The nonsystemic rules were different from the organized ones.
meanings.sent2: Her nonsystemic approach to work sometimes caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: The nonsystemic cat tried to organize the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like nonsystemic puzzle pieces, scattered and disconnected.
meanings.sent5: The nonsystemic garden grew wild and untamed, without any planned layout.

meanings.definition: Not affecting the entire system or body.
meanings.sent1: The nonsystemic leak only affected one small area of the roof.
meanings.sent2: Her nonsystemic cough was not a sign of a serious illness.
meanings.sent3: The nonsystemic sneeze startled the cat, but no one else noticed.
meanings.sent4: The nonsystemic glitch in the system caused a minor inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The nonsystemic stain on the carpet was easily removed with a simple cleaner.

meanings.sent1: Her nonsystemic thinking often led to creative solutions.
meanings.sent2: The nonsystemic reaction of the chemical surprised the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The nonsystemic behavior of the robot made it stand out from the others.
meanings.sent4: His nonsystemic approach to problem-solving was unconventional but effective.
meanings.sent5: The nonsystemic pattern on the butterfly's wings was unique among its species.
